SAFE 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • SAFE examples - apartments dataset

    SAFE examples - apartments dataset

    Anna Gierlak

    example_apartments.Rmd

    Models fitted to the original dataset - linear model and random forest:

    model_lm1 <- lm(m2.price ~ ., data = apartments)
explainer_lm1 <- explain(model_lm1, data = apartmentsTest[1:3000,2:6], y = apartmentsTest[1:3000,1], label = "lm1")
set.seed(111)
model_rf1 <- randomForest(m2.price ~ ., data = apartments)
explainer_rf1 <- explain(model_rf1, data = apartmentsTest[1:3000,2:6], y = apartmentsTest[1:3000,1], label = "rf1")

    Creating safe_extractor object using SAFE package:

    apartments_safer <- safer(explainer_rf1)
#> Variable processed: construction.year
#> Variable processed: surface
#> Variable processed: floor
#> Variable processed: no.rooms
#> Variable processed: district
    print(apartments_safer)
#> Variable 'construction.year' - selected intervals:
#>  (-Inf, 1932.6)
#>      [1932.6, 1948.8)
#>      [1948.8, 1984.8)
#>      [1984.8, Inf)
#> Variable 'surface' - selected intervals:
#>  (-Inf, 33)
#>      [33, 72)
#>      [72, 121.4)
#>      [121.4, Inf)
#> Variable 'floor' - selected intervals:
#>  (-Inf, 4)
#>      [4, Inf)
#> Variable 'no.rooms' - no transformation suggested.
#> Variable 'district' - created levels:
#>  c("Bemowo", "Bielany", "Praga", "Ursus", "Ursynow", "Wola") -> PragaUrsynowWolaBemowoBielanyUrsus
#>  Zoliborz -> Zoliborz
#>  c("Mokotow", "Ochota") -> MokotowOchota
#>  Srodmiescie -> Srodmiescie
    plot(apartments_safer, "construction.year")

    Using created object to extract new features:

    data1 <- transform_data(apartmentsTest[3001:6000,], apartments_safer)
#> Transforming 'construction.year' variable.
#> Transforming 'surface' variable.
#> Transforming 'floor' variable.
#> No transformation for 'no.rooms' variable.
#> Transforming 'district' variable.
    district m2.price construction.year surface floor no.rooms construction.year_new surface_new floor_new district_new
    Bielany 3542 1979 21 6 1 [1948.8, 1984.8) (-Inf, 33) [4, Inf) PragaUrsynowWolaBemowoBielanyUrsus
    Srodmiescie 5631 1997 107 2 4 [1984.8, Inf) [72, 121.4) (-Inf, 4) Srodmiescie
    Bielany 2989 1994 41 9 2 [1984.8, Inf) [33, 72) [4, Inf) PragaUrsynowWolaBemowoBielanyUrsus
    Ursynow 3822 1968 28 2 2 [1948.8, 1984.8) (-Inf, 33) (-Inf, 4) PragaUrsynowWolaBemowoBielanyUrsus
    Ursynow 2337 1971 146 3 6 [1948.8, 1984.8) [121.4, Inf) (-Inf, 4) PragaUrsynowWolaBemowoBielanyUrsus
    Ochota 3381 1956 97 8 3 [1948.8, 1984.8) [72, 121.4) [4, Inf) MokotowOchota

    The same with one-hot encoding:

    data1 <- transform_data(apartmentsTest[3001:6000,], apartments_safer, encoding = "one-hot")
#> Transforming 'construction.year' variable.
#> Transforming 'surface' variable.
#> Transforming 'floor' variable.
#> No transformation for 'no.rooms' variable.
#> Transforming 'district' variable.

    Backward feature selection:

    model_selection <- lm(m2.price ~ ., data = data1)
sel <- stats::step(model_selection, direction = 'backward')
#> Start:  AIC=31081.63
#> m2.price ~ district + construction.year + surface + floor + no.rooms + 
#>     construction.year_new_X2 + construction.year_new_X3 + construction.year_new_X4 + 
#>     surface_new_X2 + surface_new_X3 + surface_new_X4 + floor_new_X2 + 
#>     district_new_Zoliborz + district_new_MokotowOchota + district_new_Srodmiescie

data1 <- data1[,c(attr(sel$terms, "term.labels"), "m2.price")]
    district construction.year surface floor no.rooms construction.year_new_X2 construction.year_new_X3 construction.year_new_X4 m2.price
    Bielany 1979 21 6 1 0 1 0 3542
    Srodmiescie 1997 107 2 4 0 0 1 5631

    Ursynow 1968 28 2 2 0 1 0 3822
    Ursynow 1971 146 3 6 0 1 0 2337
    Ochota 1956 97 8 3 0 1 0 3381

    Data for exaplainers:

    data2 <- transform_data(apartmentsTest[6001:9000,], apartments_safer, encoding = "one-hot")
#> Transforming 'construction.year' variable.
#> Transforming 'surface' variable.
#> Transforming 'floor' variable.
#> No transformation for 'no.rooms' variable.
#> Transforming 'district' variable.
data2 <- data2[,c(attr(sel$terms, "term.labels"), "m2.price")]

    Fitting models to data containg newly created columns:

    model_lm2 <- lm(m2.price ~ ., data = data1)
explainer_lm2 <- explain(model_lm2, data = data2, y = apartmentsTest[6001:9000,1], label = "lm2")

set.seed(111)
model_rf2 <- randomForest(m2.price ~ ., data = data1)
explainer_rf2 <- explain(model_rf2, data2, apartmentsTest[6001:9000,1], label = "rf2")

    summary(model_lm1)
